meanings.definition: To cause harm or damage to.
meanings.sent1: Careless actions can damnify your reputation.
meanings.sent2: The storm damnified the crops in the field.
meanings.sent3: Be careful not to damnify your chances by being late.
meanings.sent4: His harsh words damnified her feelings.
meanings.sent5: The fire spread quickly, damnifying everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To injure or harm someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Running in the dark can damnify your legs.
meanings.sent2: The sharp rocks damnified his feet as he walked.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks can damnify your productivity.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter weather damnified the fragile plants.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring safety precautions can damnify your health.

meanings.definition: To cause loss or injury to.
meanings.sent1: Neglecting maintenance can damnify your car's engine.
meanings.sent2: The economic crisis damnified many small businesses.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much junk food can damnify your health in the long run.
meanings.sent4: The lawsuit damnified the company's finances.
meanings.sent5: Lack of sleep can damnify your ability to concentrate.
